{
    "number": 120127,
    "data": "1,2,3,4,7,9,10,11,12,14,16,18,19,22,23,27,31,32,33,34,38,43,46,47,49,54,57,59,62,64,67,71,72,76,78,79,81,83,84,86,94,98,99,103,107,108,118,121,122,124,127,128,129,131,133,134,135,139,142,151,152,155,158,162",
    "name": "Numbers that are never the longest side of a primitive Heronian triangle.",
    "comment": [
        "The Mathematica program below accesses a table of primitive Heronian triples (PHT) generated by Sascha Kurz (see Link). The list contains a triple for every possible PHT with a maximum side length of 10000. The triples are in the form (a,b,c) where a >= b >= c and where a <= 10000. - _Frank M Jackson_, Dec 04 2017"
    ],
    "link": [
        "Frank M Jackson, <a href=\"/A120127/b120127.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1500</a>",
        "Sascha Kurz, <a href=\"http://hdl.handle.net/10525/382\">On the generation of Heronian triangles</a>, Serdica Journal of Computing. 2 (2) (2008): pp. 181-196.",
        "Sascha Kurz, <a href=\"http://www.wm-archive.uni-bayreuth.de/index.php?id=554&amp;L=3\">Lists of primitive Heronian triples</a>, Bayreuth University.",
        "Michael Somos, <a href=\"http://somos.crg4.com/tritab.html\">Heronian Triangle Table</a>",
        "P. Yiu, <a href=\"http://math.fau.edu/yiu/RecreationalMathematics2003.pdf\">Heron triangles with sides < 100</a>, Recreational Mathematics, Appendix Chap. 9.3 pp. 81/360. (This is a download of 360 pages.)"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "lst1 = ReadList[\"C:/primitive_heronian_triangles_1_10000.txt\", {Number,Number,Number}]; lst = Union@Table[lst1[[n]][[1]], {n, 1, Length[lst1]}];Select[Range[10000], ! MemberQ[lst, #] &] (* For download of file of primitive Heronian triples see Link *) (* _Frank M Jackson_, Dec 04 2017 *)"
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn",
    "offset": "1,2",
    "author": "_Lekraj Beedassy_, Jun 10 2006",
    "references": 1,
    "revision": 28,
    "time": "2017-12-07T02:52:29-05:00",
    "created": "2006-09-29T03:00:00-04:00"
}
